eta_utility.eta_x.config moduleÔÉÅ

class eta_utility.eta_x.config.ConfigOpt(*, config_name: str, path_root: Path, relpath_results: str, relpath_scenarios: str | None = None, setup: ConfigOptSetup, settings: ConfigOptSettings)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

Configuration for the optimization, which can be loaded from a JSON file.

config_name: strÔÉÅ

Name of the configuration used for the series of run.

path_root: PathÔÉÅ

Root path for the optimization run (scenarios and results are relative to this).

relpath_results: strÔÉÅ

Relative path to the results folder.

relpath_scenarios: str | NoneÔÉÅ

relative path to the scenarios folder (default: None).

path_results: PathÔÉÅ

Path to the results folder.

path_scenarios: Path | NoneÔÉÅ

Path to the scenarios folder (default: None).

setup: ConfigOptSetupÔÉÅ

Optimization run setup.

settings: ConfigOptSettingsÔÉÅ

Optimization run settings.

classmethod from_json(file: Path, path_root: Path, overwrite: Mapping[str, Any] | None = None) → ConfigOpt[source]ÔÉÅ

Load configuration from JSON file, which consists of the following sections:

  • paths: In this section, the (relative) file paths for results and scenarios are specified. The paths are deserialized directly into the ConfigOpt object.

  • setup: This section specifies which classes and utilities should be used for optimization. The setup configuration is deserialized into the ConfigOptSetup object.

  • settings: The settings section contains basic parameters for the optimization, it is deserialized into a ConfigOptSettings object.

  • environment_specific: The environment section contains keyword arguments for the environment. This section must contain values for the arguments of the environment, the expected values are therefore different depending on the environment and not fully documented here.

  • agent_specific: The agent section contains keyword arguments for the control algorithm (agent). This section must contain values for the arguments of the agent, the expected values are therefore different depending on the agent and not fully documented here.

Parameters:

  • file ‚Äì Path to the configuration file.

  • overwrite ‚Äì Config parameters to overwrite.

Returns:

ConfigOpt object.

class eta_utility.eta_x.config.ConfigOptSetup(*, agent_import: str, environment_import: str, interaction_env_import: str | None = None, vectorizer_import='stable_baselines3.common.vec_env.dummy_vec_env.DummyVecEnv', policy_import='eta_utility.eta_x.common.NoPolicy', monitor_wrapper=False, norm_wrapper_obs=False, norm_wrapper_reward=False, tensorboard_log=False)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

Configuration options as specified in the ‚Äúsetup‚Äù section of the configuration file.

Import description string for the agent class.

Agent class (automatically determined from agent_import).

Import description string for the environment class.

environment_class: type[BaseEnv]ÔÉÅ

Imported Environment class (automatically determined from environment_import).

interaction_env_import: str | NoneÔÉÅ

Import description string for the interaction environment (default: None).

interaction_env_class: type[BaseEnv] | NoneÔÉÅ

Interaction environment class (default: None) (automatically determined from interaction_env_import).

vectorizer_import: strÔÉÅ

Import description string for the environment vectorizer (default: stable_baselines3.common.vec_env.dummy_vec_env.DummyVecEnv).

vectorizer_class: type[DummyVecEnv]ÔÉÅ

Environment vectorizer class (automatically determined from vectorizer_import).

policy_import: strÔÉÅ

Import description string for the policy class (default: eta_utility.eta_x.agents.common.NoPolicy).

policy_class: type[BasePolicy]ÔÉÅ

Policy class (automatically determined from policy_import).

monitor_wrapper: boolÔÉÅ

Flag which is true if the environment should be wrapped for monitoring (default: False).

norm_wrapper_obs: boolÔÉÅ

Flag which is true if the observations should be normalized (default: False).

norm_wrapper_reward: boolÔÉÅ

Flag which is true if the rewards should be normalized (default: False).

tensorboard_log: boolÔÉÅ

Flag to enable tensorboard logging (default: False).

class eta_utility.eta_x.config.ConfigOptSettings(*, seed=None, verbose=2, n_environments=1, n_episodes_play=None, n_episodes_learn=None, interact_with_env=False, save_model_every_x_episodes=10, plot_interval=10, episode_duration, sampling_time, sim_steps_per_sample=None, scale_actions=None, round_actions=None, environment=NOTHING, interaction_env: dict[str, Any] | None = None, agent=NOTHING, log_to_file=False)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

seed: int | NoneÔÉÅ

Seed for random sampling (default: None).

verbose: intÔÉÅ

Logging verbosity of the framework (default: 2).

n_environments: intÔÉÅ

Number of vectorized environments to instantiate (if not using DummyVecEnv) (default: 1).

n_episodes_play: int | NoneÔÉÅ

Number of episodes to execute when the agent is playing (default: None).

n_episodes_learn: int | NoneÔÉÅ

Number of episodes to execute when the agent is learning (default: None).

interact_with_env: boolÔÉÅ

Flag to determine whether the interaction env is used or not (default: False).

save_model_every_x_episodes: intÔÉÅ

How often to save the model during training (default: 10 - after every ten episodes).

plot_interval: intÔÉÅ

How many episodes to pass between each render call (default: 10 - after every ten episodes).

episode_duration: floatÔÉÅ

Duration of an episode in seconds (can be a float value).

sampling_time: floatÔÉÅ

Duration between time samples in seconds (can be a float value).

sim_steps_per_sample: int | NoneÔÉÅ

Simulation steps for every sample.

scale_actions: float | NoneÔÉÅ

Multiplier for scaling the agent actions before passing them to the environment (especially useful with interaction environments) (default: None).

round_actions: int | NoneÔÉÅ

Number of digits to round actions to before passing them to the environment (especially useful with interaction environments) (default: None).

environment: dict[str, Any]ÔÉÅ

Settings dictionary for the environment.

interaction_env: dict[str, Any] | NoneÔÉÅ

Settings dictionary for the interaction environment (default: None).

agent: dict[str, Any]ÔÉÅ

Settings dictionary for the agent.

log_to_file: boolÔÉÅ

Flag which is true if the log output should be written to a file

Bases: object

Configuration for an optimization run, including the series and run names descriptions and paths for the run.

Name of the series of optimization runs.

Root path of the framework run.

Path to scenarios used for the optimization run.

Path for the results of the series of optimization runs.

Path to the model of the optimization run.

Path to information about the optimization run.

Path to the monitoring information about the optimization run.

Path to the normalization wrapper information.

Path to the log output file.

create_results_folders() → None[source]ÔÉÅ

Create the results folders for an optimization run (or check if they already exist).

set_env_info(env: type[BaseEnv]) → None[source]ÔÉÅ

Set the environment information of the optimization run to represent the given environment. The information will default to None if this is never called.

Parameters:

env ‚Äì The environment whose description should be used.

set_interaction_env_info(env: type[BaseEnv]) → None[source]ÔÉÅ

Set the interaction environment information of the optimization run to represent the given environment. The information will default to None if this is never called.

Parameters:

env ‚Äì The environment whose description should be used.

property paths: dict[str, Path]ÔÉÅ

Dictionary of all paths for the optimization run. This is for easier access and contains all paths as mentioned above.
